text: The or MOMAKMOMAK is an English acronym. MOMAK stands for "Museum Of Modern Art, Kkoto. is one of the major art museums in Japan.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Museums" in Japan Encyclopedia, pp. 671-673. It is in the Okazaki area in Kyoto.Turp, John. (2007). DK Eyewitness Travel Guide: Japan, p. 168; MOMAK, Getting to MOMAK; retrieved 2012-2-8. The museum has modern art, including Japanese-style painting (nihonga), Western-style painting (yōga), prints, sculpture, crafts and photography.National Museum of Modern Art, Kyoto (MOMAK), Collection Gallery; retrieved 2012-2-8. The Museum is currently undergoing renovation and will reopen in April 2012. ==History== MOMAK was established in 1963. In the early days, it was a part of the National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo. It was an annex.MOMAK, About MOMAK; retrieved 2012-2-8. In 1967, this annex became the National Museum of Modern Art, Kyoto. The current building was designed by Fumihiko Maki.
